citation: _King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Authors / Order: The citation begins with the title. For a web page the reference should begin with the author. If no individual author is given, the organization that produced the page (King James Bible Online) should be used as the author. If the organization is used as author, the website name is omitted.
   Should be: King James Bible Online. (as the author at the start of the reference)

❌ Date: The citation shows only the year "(2017)". For a web page the date should be in the order Year, Month Day if that full date is available.
   Should be: (2017, Month Day) — e.g., (2017, January 15). If only the year is available on the page, (2017) is acceptable, but include the full date when the page provides it.

❌ Placement of original-publication note: "(Original work published: 1769)" is placed after the URL. In APA 7 the original-publication parenthetical belongs immediately after the title, not after the URL, and it should not use a colon.
   Should be: _King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769)

❌ Punctuation before URL: The citation has a period immediately before the URL (there is a period then a space before "https..."). APA 7 requires no punctuation immediately before a URL — end the preceding element with a space (no period) and then give the URL.
   Should be: ..._King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769) https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

✓ Title formatting: The title is italicized (indicated by underscores) — this is correct for a book/complete work.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Suggested corrected reference (choose full date if available):

King James Bible Online. (2017, Month Day). _King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769) https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

If only the year is available on the page, use:

King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769) https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

citation: Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Editors / Year (order & punctuation): The year is written as plain "2019." after the editors. In APA 7 the editors element is followed by its closing parenthesis and a period, then the publication year must appear in its own parentheses.
   Should be: Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019).

❌ Title (capitalization): The book title is presented in title case ("_A New Companion to Malory_"). APA 7 requires book titles in the reference list to be in sentence case (only the first word and proper nouns capitalized) and italicized.
   Should be: _A new companion to Malory_

Corrected example (APA 7 format):
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A new companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

citation: I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: other (ISO standard)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Incorrect/abbreviated author name
   What's wrong: "I. O. for Standardization." is not the proper author name for the organization.
   Should be: "International Organization for Standardization." (spell out the organization name as the author)

❌ Title capitalization: Title not in sentence case
   What's wrong: "Requirements" is capitalized; APA 7 uses sentence case for titles in references (only first word and proper nouns capitalized).
   Should be: "_Occupational health and safety management systems—requirements with guidance for use_"

❌ Punctuation before URL: Period immediately before URL
   What's wrong: There is a period right before the URL: "). https://..." — APA rule: no punctuation (period or comma) should appear directly before a URL.
   Should be: Close the parentheses, then a space, then the URL with no intervening period: ") https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html"

Corrected example (using underscores to indicate italics as in input):
International Organization for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018) https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
